buildings.name: Eiffel Tower
buildings.fun_fact: It was constructed for the 1889 Exposition Universelle in Paris.

buildings.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
buildings.fun_fact: It's the oldest and last remaining of the original seven world wonders.

buildings.name: St. Peter's Basilica
buildings.fun_fact: It Took 120 Years To Build and was only finished in 1675.

buildings.name: Empire State Building
buildings.fun_fact: The Empire State Building is an iconic skyscraper in New York City and was the tallest building in the world until 1970.

buildings.name: Space Needle
buildings.fun_fact: The Space Needle is an observation tower and a prominent landmark in Seattle. Built for the 1962 World's Fair, it offers panoramic views of the city, including the downtown skyline, Elliott Bay, and the surrounding mountains.

buildings.name: Tokyo Tower
buildings.fun_fact: The Tokyo Tower gets a fresh coat of paint every five years. It takes a whole year to paint the entire tower.

buildings.name: Tower of Pisa
buildings.fun_fact: The Leaning Tower of Pisa is famous for its unintended tilt. It began to lean during construction due to an inadequate foundation.

buildings.name: Euromast
buildings.fun_fact: It is possible for participants to descend from a height of 100 meters (328 feet) under the guidance of experienced instructors.

buildings.name: Alexander Nevsky Cathedral
buildings.fun_fact: It was built in the early 20th century and features stunning Byzantine and Bulgarian architectural elements. The cathedral is dedicated to the memory of Russian soldiers who died during the Russo-Turkish War of 1877-1878.

buildings.name: Marina Bay Sands
buildings.fun_fact: Marina Bay Sands is an iconic integrated resort complex located in Singapore, known for its distinctive architecture and luxurious amenities.

buildings.name: Sydney Opera House
buildings.fun_fact: The iconic exterior of the Opera House is made up of over one million glazed white ceramic tiles. The tiles were specially designed to reflect sunlight and create an ever-changing appearance throughout the day.

buildings.name: Reichstag Building
buildings.fun_fact: It is the seat of the German parliament (Bundestag). It is a historic building with a modern glass dome that offers panoramic views of Berlin. The Reichstag has witnessed significant events throughout Germany's history and stands as a symbol of democracy.

buildings.name: Cologne Cathedral
buildings.fun_fact: The Cologne Cathedral is a magnificent Gothic masterpiece and one of the largest cathedrals in the world. Construction of the cathedral began in the 13th century and was completed in the 19th century. It is known for its intricate architecture, stunning stained glass windows, and its Shrine of the Three Kings, which is said to hold the relics of the biblical Magi.
